text:
"All we want is to be treated like human beings."
50 years ago, NYC's jails erupted in massive protests that feel more relevant than ever in the wake of the recent Metropolitan Detention Center horrors. The brilliant @hthompsn resurrects the story
author: lizzyratner

text: @guybenbrown You are the best. Hugs to you and my beloved cuzzy.
author: lizzyratner

text: Sixteen years ago, @thenation stood firmly and fiercely against the US invasion of Iraq. Hundreds of thousands of deaths later, it's painful to think back to that desperate time—and even more painful to think about all that has followed. That still follows.
author: lizzyratner

text: We're just beginning to learn about the terror and death the US is inflicting in Somalia. A new Amnesty International report says this country's actions could constitute war crimes.
author: lizzyratner

text: Riddle: How does a group of Palestinians manage to challenge the Israeli settlement project in a US Court using the Fair Housing Act and a lawsuit involving @Airbnb? @MairavZ has the answer, while @sam_lavigne has the graphics. Thanks also to @eyebeamnyc
author: lizzyratner

text: The New Zealand shooter's manifesto is a wiki for right-wing terrorism. It's also the key to understanding what happened, and what might yet happen. via@thenation and the brilliant @BayoumiMoustafa https://www.thenation.com/article/new-zealand-massacre-norway-hate-wiki/ … #NewZealandShooting
author: lizzyratner

text: Brett Kavanaugh is on the bench, ruling the wrong way on the regular, but he shouldn't be—and he doesn't have to be. Here's 83 reasons why he can and should be impeached. Courtesy of the ever-amazing @elienyc via @thenation
author: lizzyratner

text:
For the first time, Palestinians are using the US courts to challenge the Israeli settlement enterprise. @MairavZ has the scoop, while @sam_lavigne brings the brilliant graphics
 via @thenation https://www.thenation.com/article/palestinians-legal-challenge-airbnb-settlers/ …
author: lizzyratner

text: My old Observer editor, Peter Kaplan, used to say #JaredKushner "doesn't know what he doesn't know." At the time, it felt like a wholly inadequate critique. Now it feels prescient. (Kaplan also said Jared's got ice in his veins. Also prescient.) https://nyti.ms/2TJyhsj  @Matthaber
author: lizzyratner

text: In an act of legal jujitsu, Palestinians have intervened in an Airbnb lawsuit to sue Israeli settlers. It marks the first time Palestinians have taken on the settler enterprise in a US court via @thenation https://www.thenation.com/article/palestinians-legal-challenge-airbnb-settlers/ … @theCCR
author: lizzyratner
